definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Have the witness describe the car.
Two eyewitnesses averred they had seen the defendant at the scene.
sentences.chinese: 两个目击者断言他们在现场看到了那个被告。

sentences.english: According to data of eye-witnesses around Nablus tanks were stationed also approximately.
sentences.chinese: 据资料目击者纳布卢斯附近的坦克也派驻了大约。

sentences.english: Witnesses said the bomb hit the refugees as they were sheltering under trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 目击者称，难民在树林和树丛中避难时遭到炸弹袭击。

sentences.english: The US-led NATO forces have cordoned off the scene of the incident, witnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 目击者说北约军队在事故现场在实施了警戒。

sentences.english: How can all those eye-witnesses to these creatures of the night be wrong?
sentences.chinese: 在晚上看到这些吸血鬼人的目击者怎么可能是错的呢？

sentences.english: The bulk of evidence for such "unexplained" reports are eyewitness accounts.
sentences.chinese: 大量的“无法解释的”证据都是目击者叙述的。

sentences.english: In criminal cases, the most common witnesses are police officers and eyewitnesses.
sentences.chinese: 在刑事案件中，最常见的证人是警官和目击者。

sentences.english: FOX was just repeating the information from people who claimed to be eye-witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 但FOX一直在重申，这些信息是目击者亲眼所见。

sentences.english: Her account of the incident approximates to that of the other witness.
sentences.chinese: 她对事件的叙述与另一位目击者的叙述相近。

sentences.english: The witness asserted that the salesman was dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 目击者断言那售货员是不诚实的。

sentences.english: They fabricated evidence and threatened witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他们伪造证据并威胁目击者。

sentences.english: Many of the girls arriving at the border had been raped, witnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 目击者说，很多到了国境线的女孩子都遭到过侮辱。

sentences.english: Beijing Time. The plane broke into two, according to witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 目击者称，飞机在降落之前就断成两截。

sentences.english: Two of the robbers threatened to duff the witness up if he went to the police.
sentences.chinese: 强盗中的两人威胁目击者说，如果他去报警就狠揍他。

sentences.english: Witnesses reported flames rising up to 200 feet into the air.
sentences.chinese: 目击者称，火焰窜入了200英尺的空中。

definition: to see with one's own eyes/to witness
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
to send or deliver to the hospital
